course.subject: HUMA
course.name: World Literature and Film
course.description: This course explores the complex interplay between literature and cinema. Selected novels, short stories and plays are analyzed in relation to their cinematic adaptations to gain an understanding of the masterpieces of world literature, and the possibilities and challenges involved in their cinematic manifestations.

reviews.author: MHH
reviews.title: watch films with legal reason
reviews.comment_content:
-bi-directional analysis one is like literature and one is about how to film a film (the way to express emotions, the technique to change the ambiance with light and music)

Films:
1. The Name of the Rose(Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud, 1986)

2. Kafuka: Inaka IshaorA Country Doctor(Dir: K≈çji Yamamura, 2007)

3. Letter from an Unknown Woman(Dir: Xu Jinglei 2005)

4. L'amant(Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud, 1992)

5. Sorekara, or And Then (Dir: Yoshimitsu Morita, 1985)

And some YouTube video clips shared. Video speaks louder than words.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-constrained by the time slot (Fri 9:00-11:50), the content seems to be a little bit rush that not enough time to cover both film and literature.

-intelligible PowerPoint, key points and concepts are extracted and inspiring questions are asked for deeper understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: -fair subject weighting, encouraging students to concentrate on the paper and presentation preparation mainly, helps light the burden and more time to prepare
reviews.comment_workload:
-three readings materials per week, around 6-8 hours spent on reading material every week (depends on the length of the film or story) + some sudden quiz for each fiction during lecture

-stuck on writing paper (~1500 words), the guideline regarding how to write a scholarly paper as this is a combined analysis of film and literature somehow (they are separate system to evaluate after all) . It maybe better if the TA could hold one section teaching how to write the final paper (especially for those who has not registered any HUMA course before)
